metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Classes
ECMAScript 2015, also known as ES6, introduced JavaScript Classes.
content.html: ECMAScript 2015, also known as ES6, introduced JavaScript Classes.

content.text: JavaScript Classes are templates for JavaScript Objects.
content.html: JavaScript Classes are templates for JavaScript Objects.

content.text: JavaScript Class Syntax
Use the keyword class to create a class.
content.html: Use the keyword class to create a class.

content.text: Always add a method named constructor() :
content.html: Always add a method named constructor():

content.code_html:
class ClassName {
  constructor() { ... }
}

class Car {
  constructor(name, year) {
    this.name = name;
    this.year = year;
  }
}

content.text: The example above creates a class named "Car".
content.html: The example above creates a class named "Car".

content.text: The class has two initial properties: "name" and "year".
content.html: The class has two initial properties: "name" and "year".

content.text: A JavaScript class is not an object.
content.html: A JavaScript class is not an object.

content.text: It is a template for JavaScript objects.
content.html: It is a template for JavaScript objects.

content.text: Using a Class
When you have a class, you can use the class to create objects:
content.html: When you have a class, you can use the class to create objects:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
const myCar1 = new Car("Ford", 2014);
const myCar2 = new Car("Audi", 2019);

content.code:
const myCar1 = new Car("Ford", 2014);
const myCar2 = new Car("Audi", 2019);

syntax_highlighting.text:
const myCar1 = new Car("Ford", 2014);
const myCar2 = new Car("Audi", 2019);

content.code_html:
const myCar1 = new Car("Ford", 2014);
const myCar2 = new Car("Audi", 2019);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
const myCar1 = new Car("Ford", 2014);
const myCar2 = new Car("Audi", 2019);

content.text: The example above uses the Car class to create two Car objects .
content.html: The example above uses the Car class to create two Car objects.

content.text: The constructor method is called automatically when a new object is created.
content.html: The constructor method is called automatically when a new object is created.

content.text: The Constructor Method
The constructor method is a special method:
content.html: The constructor method is a special method:

content.text: If you do not define a constructor method, JavaScript will add an empty constructor method.
content.html: If you do not define a constructor method, JavaScript will add an empty constructor method.

content.text: Class Methods
Class methods are created with the same syntax as object methods.
content.html: Class methods are created with the same syntax as object methods.

content.text: Use the keyword class to create a class.
content.html: Use the keyword class to create a class.

content.text: Always add a constructor() method.
content.html: Always add a constructor() method.

content.text: Then add any number of methods.
content.html: Then add any number of methods.

content.code_html:
class ClassName {
  constructor() { ... }
  method_1() { ... }
  method_2() { ... }
  method_3() { ... }
}

content.text: Create a Class method named "age", that returns the Car age:
content.html: Create a Class method named "age", that returns the Car age:

content.code_html:
class Car {
  constructor(name, year) {
    this.name = name;
    this.year = year;
  }
  age() {
    const date = new Date();
    return date.getFullYear() - this.year;
  }
}

const myCar = new Car("Ford", 2014);
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML =
"My car is " + myCar.age() + " years old.";

content.text: You can send parameters to Class methods:
content.html: You can send parameters to Class methods:

content.code_html:
class Car {
  constructor(name, year) {
    this.name = name;
    this.year = year;
  }
  age(x) {
    return x - this.year;
  }
}

const date = new Date();
let year = date.getFullYear();

const myCar = new Car("Ford", 2014);
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML=
"My car is " + myCar.age(year) + " years old.";

content.text: Browser Support
The following table defines the first browser version with full support for Classes in JavaScript:
content.html: The following table defines the first browser version with full support for Classes in JavaScript:

content.code_html:
Chrome 49 Edge 12 Firefox 45 Safari 9 Opera 36
Mar, 2016 Jul, 2015 Mar, 2016 Oct, 2015 Mar, 2016

content.text: You will learn a lot more about JavaScript Classes later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn a lot more about JavaScript Classes later in this tutorial.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
There is one method all classes should have, which one?
content.html: There is one method all classes should have, which one?
